newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israeli border policeman killed in West Bank.
newsitem.headline: Israeli border policeman killed in West Bank.

text.p: An Israeli paramilitary policeman was shot dead in an exchange of fire with Palestinians near the West Bank town of Tulkarm on Friday, Israeli security sources said.
The policeman was the 12th Israeli killed since Israeli-Palestinian violence erupted in the aftermath of Israel's opening on Tuesday of a tunnel near Moslem holy sites in Jerusalem.
On Jerusalem's Temple Mount, Islam's third holiest shrine, paramilitary police shot dead two Palestinians during protests after Moslem prayers on Friday, hospital sources said.
More than 50 Arabs were wounded in the Temple Mount violence, during which Israeli security forces also fired tear gas and clubbed demonstrators, the sources said.
Some 12,000 Palestinians marched on the settlement of Ginat in the West Bank and Israeli soldiers shot and wounded six Arabs, witnesses said. Palestinian police then shot back.

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has appealed to Palestinian President Yassser Arafat to meet him to try to defuse the worst Israeli-Palestinian violence since Israel and the PLO signed an interim peace deal in 1993.
